summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to FBI agents, requesting interviews of three inmates who were housed in the same Special Housing Unit (SHU) wing as Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The email provides background on the inmates' charges and instructs agents on how to conduct the voluntary witness interviews regarding their observations of Epstein on the night of his death.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death by interviewing inmate witnesses shortly after it occurred.
Three inmates from the same SHU wing as Epstein were to be interviewed voluntarily as witnesses, not subjects, of the investigation.
The inmates were instructed not to discuss their own ongoing criminal cases or the reason they were in the SHU during the interviews.
The investigative focus was on what the inmates observed Epstein say and do, whether checks were performed, and any other relevant information about him.
The document reveals the immediate post-death investigative steps taken by federal authorities, highlighting concerns about the events in the MCC SHU.
